No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 805, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 602, 213, 616]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 728, 650]]<|/det|>

Radioactive isotopes are used in some medical treatments.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 256, 918, 289]]<|/det|>
Radium-223 ( \({ }_{88}^{223} \mathrm{Ra}\) ) is an isotope of radium. Radium-223 decays by the emission of alpha \((\alpha)\) particles to an isotope of radon (Rn).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 305, 184, 321]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 305, 568, 321]]<|/det|>
Complete the nuclide equation for this decay.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[343, 333, 660, 364]]<|/det|>
\[
{ }_{88}^{223} \mathrm{Ra} \longrightarrow{ } \xrightarrow{\quad} \mathrm{Rn} +{ } \xrightarrow{\quad} \alpha
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 376, 866, 392]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 396, 184, 412]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 396, 700, 412]]<|/det|>
Radium-223 is injected into the body to treat a specific organ.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 425, 593, 441]]<|/det|>
Explain why the source must be inside the body.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 515, 136, 531]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 515, 918, 563]]<|/det|>
An isotope of technetium is injected into the body to detect cancer in one of the organs. The half-life of this isotope is 6 hours and it decays by emitting gamma \((\gamma)\) radiation. The radiation is detected outside the body.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 578, 184, 594]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 578, 605, 594]]<|/det|>
Explain why a source of gamma radiation is used.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 640, 866, 656]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 670, 184, 686]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 670, 658, 686]]<|/det|>
